section.title: Present Perfect Simple (for experience)
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Perfect to talk about an experience in the past. The exact time is not known or not important. We use the Past Simple if we give the exact time. Make the Present Perfect with have/has + past participle.
section.text2: She wrote two books in the 1980's.
section.sectiontitle2: Make the negative of the Present Perfect with haven't/hasn't + past participle.
section.text3: We have heard this music before.
section.text3a: We haven't heard this music before.

section.title: Present Perfect Simple (for experience)
section.sectiontitle: Make questions with: (question word +) have/has + past participle.
section.sectiontitle2: To make short answers, use have/has or haven't/hasn't.
section.text3: A: Have you seen the film?
section.text4: A: Has he sold his car?
